intro: Eryngium lemmonii, commonly known as Lemmon's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its leaves are spiny and gray-green, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Eryngium lemmonii is known for its resilience to drought and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
